member.name: T:Arx.AccountBalance
member.summary: Represents the balance owing of an account.
member.remarks: The balance of an account is broken up into several s that represent distinct portions of the overall balance. An account balance cannot be updated directly. To affect an account balance a must be posted to the account using the method or one of it's overloads.

member.name: T:Arx.ExternalDataResultInterpretation
member.summary: Represents an external data result interpretation.
member.remarks: External data result interpretations provide meaning to external data results. For a result to be matched to an interpretation the of the result must match the of the interpretation, the must be between the and properties of the interpretation and the must be between the and properties of the interpretation. Interpretations can be used to give meaning to a range of results, for instance a result that is a credit score of 500 could be interpreted that has a of 400 and a of 600, providing a of the credit score as "Good". The interpretation also contains the associated with the result and links the result to the s that can be applied to the account for this result (according to the .

member.name: T:Arx.AccountGroupingProfile
member.summary: Contains instructions for determining if an account should be grouped with another account.
member.remarks: Account grouping profiles contain instructions that determine when accounts will be automatically grouped with other accounts based on information that is the same in both accounts. Accounts will only be automatically grouped if their shares the same account grouping profile.

member.name: T:Arx.Account
member.summary: Represents an account entity.
member.remarks:
Accounts are the primary focus of the ARx system. They can represent people that need to be contacted and / or debts to be collected. The classes that control how the agents can interact with the account include:
The current status of the account () controls what type of transactions can be posted to an account and whether or not mail can be sent to the account. Certain are used to control the operations that can be performed on accounts that are in a closed status. The that a has are controlled by the , these rights as well as the and also determine which users can set accounts to which statuses.
Defines the available s that can be used to schedule s and links the account to a and .
Provides meaningful names for the data and defines the user access level required to view and change data elements of the account.
Defines a number of business rules that determine and control what can be done with an account.
The desk an account is assigned to controls what type of transactions can be posted to the account and whether or not mail can be sent to the account. The desk also determines what receives commission by default () when a payment is posted to the account.
Determines which letters will be sent to the account and when the letters will be sent.
Links to the and determines which accounts the user can view or work based on the , , and the user has access to.
Controls the specific actions that an agent may perform on an account.
Defines when and how often certain events should happen during the life of an account.

member.name: M:Arx.Account.ApplyActionCode(Arx.ActionCode,System.Int32,System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Applies an action code to an account.
member.param: The action code to be applied.
The position Id.

The phone number to apply the action code to. This is required for action codes that are related to phones only. When applying an action code that is not related to a telephone number you may pass null to this value.
The date and time to apply the action code for. This can be used to backdate the action code. To apply the action code for the current date and time pass null for this parameter.
A note that will be added to the account when the action code is applied.
The source environment applying the action code.
member.remarks: This method can be used to apply any action code to an account.

member.name: M:Arx.Managers.ExternalDataResultManager.Process(Arx.ExternalDataResult)
member.summary: Processes an external data result and performs any associated result instructions.
member.param: The external data result to process.
member.remarks:
The steps for processing new records in the ExternalDataResult table:
1.For account find client Profile record
2.Using the values in ExternalDataResult(ProviderServiceId int, Result int, ResultDate date), match to one record in ExternalDataResultInterpretation (ProviderServiceId, ResultDate between StartEffectiveDate and EndEffectiveDate, Result between RangeStart and RangeEnd)
3.Get the list of records, in the ExternalDataResultProfileInstructions table, which match the ExternalDataResultInterpretation record(ResultInterpretationId), and also matches the Profile ID.
4.Go through the result list, and perform those Instructions on the account
member.returns: The process result status.

member.name: M:Arx.Managers.AccountManager.ApplyActionCode(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Applies an action code to an account without retrieving the account or action code from the database. NOTE: If is set to false the account and action code will be retrieved and full validation performed.
member.param: The unique id of the account to apply the action code to.
The unique id of the action code to apply.
The phone number to apply the action code to.
The date and time of the action. If this value is null the system date and time is used.
The user id to apply the action code as.
The position id of the user.
An important note to add along with the action code.
The source of the action code.
A value indicating whether or not validation should be skipped.
member.remarks: This overload should only be used for high volume application of action codes when it is known that the account and action code exist. The parameter must be set to true otherwise full validation of the account user and action code will be performed and the action code will be entered as the currently logged in user.

member.name: M:Arx.Managers.ActionCodeManager.CanActionCodeBeAppliedToAccount(Arx.Account,Arx.ActionCode)
member.summary: Checks whether or not an action code can be applied to an account.
member.param: The account to check.
The action code to check.
member.exception: Thrown if the account does not have a valid client.

Thrown in the following cases:
The action code is not allowed by the .
The action code stops interest but interest has already been stopped on the account.
The account is closed and the user does not have the right.
The account is on a support desk that is not in the user's support work list and the user does not have the right.
The user's access level is less than the value.
Thrown if or is null.

member.name: T:Arx.PostDatedPaymentInterestPlan
member.summary: Defines rules for stopping or starting the interest calculation on an account when postdated payments are added or processed.

member.name: T:Arx.PostDatedPaymentInterestPlan.PostDatedPaymentStopInterestMode
member.summary: Defines the options for when to stop calculating interest on an account based on queued postdated payment on the account.

member.name: F:Arx.PostDatedPaymentInterestPlan.PostDatedPaymentStopInterestMode.DoNotStopInterest
member.summary: Do not stop calculating interest on the account.

member.name: F:Arx.PostDatedPaymentInterestPlan.PostDatedPaymentStopInterestMode.StopInteterst
member.summary: Stop interest as soon as a PDP is queued on the account.

member.name: F:Arx.PostDatedPaymentInterestPlan.PostDatedPaymentStopInterestMode.StopInterestAtPercentOfBalance
member.summary: Stop interest if total amount of queued payments is greater than or equal to the stop interest value as a percent of the account's current balance,

member.name: F:Arx.PostDatedPaymentInterestPlan.PostDatedPaymentStopInterestMode.StopInterestAtNumberOfPayments
member.summary: Stop interest if the number of queued payments is greater than or equal to the stop interest value.

member.name: P:Arx.PostDatedPaymentInterestPlan.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique name for this postdated payment interest plan.

member.name: P:Arx.PostDatedPaymentInterestPlan.RestartInterest
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not interest calculations should be restarted when all postdated payments have been processed or cancelled.

member.name: P:Arx.PostDatedPaymentInterestPlan.StopInterstMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates if and when interest calculation should be stopped for an account.
member.remarks: PostDatedPaymentStopInterestMode.DoNotStopInterest - Interest calculation will not be stopped on the account. PostDatedPaymentStopInterestMode.StopInteterst - Interest calculation will be stopped when a PDP is queued on the account. PostDatedPaymentStopInterestMode.StopInterestAtPercentOfBalance - Interest calculation will be stopped if the total amount of queued PDPs is greater than the StopInterestValue as a % of the account's current balance. PostDatedPaymentStopInterestMode.StopInterestAtNumberOfPayments - Interest calculation will be stopped if the number of queued PDPs is greater than or equal to the StopInterestValue.

member.name: P:Arx.PostDatedPaymentInterestPlan.StopInterestValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the value at which to stop interest based on the StopInterestMode
member.remarks: PostDatedPaymentStopInterestMode.DoNotStopInterest - Interest calculation will not be stopped on the account. PostDatedPaymentStopInterestMode.StopInteterst - Interest calculation will be stopped when a PDP is queued on the account. PostDatedPaymentStopInterestMode.StopInterestAtPercentOfBalance - Interest calculation will be stopped if the total amount of queued PDPs is greater than the StopInterestValue as a % of the account's current balance. PostDatedPaymentStopInterestMode.StopInterestAtNumberOfPayments - Interest calculation will be stopped if the number of queued PDPs is greater than or equal to the StopInterestValue.

member.name: M:Arx.Utils.Data.DataUtilities.SqlExecuteRecord``1(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Executes a parameterized SQL query and returns the first record of the result set as an object of type T.
member.typeparam: The type of object to return.
member.param: The query to execute.
A dictionary with the key representing the parameter name and the value representing the parameter value.
member.returns: The first record of the result set as an object of type T.
member.remarks: Properties of the object returned will be set to values from the database when the property name matches the field name from the record set. Properties whose names do not match field names will not be set.

member.remarks: The localized values must be placed in a resource file (.RESX) in the same assembly as the enumeration type that is named the same as the enumeration type. For example: an enumeration type named InterestStoppedReason in the ARx.dll assembly there must be a resource file named InterestStoppedReason.[culture].resx in the ARx.dll to resolve to. If the resource is not in the same namespace as the enum type add any namespaces to search using the method.

member.name: M:Arx.Utils.DecimalUtilities.ToEbcdicZonedDecimalString(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Converts the decimal to a EBCDIC Zoned Decimal string with 2 implied decimal places.
member.param: The decimal to convert.
member.returns: A string representation of the decimal encoded as an EBCDIC Zoned Decimal
member.remarks:
EBCDIC Zoned Decimal format, also known as IBM Numeric replaces the right-most digit with a character that represents the value and the sign of the number. The values for the last character are:
ASCII Character Value ASCII Character Value
{0}-0
A1J-1
B2K-2
C3L-3
D4M-4
E5N-5
F6O-6
G7P-7
H8Q-8
I9R-9

E5N-5

member.name: M:Arx.Utils.DecimalUtilities.ToMicroFocusZonedDecimalString(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Converts a decimal value to a string in the MicroFocus zoned decimal format with 2 implied decimal places.
member.param: The decimal to convert.
member.returns: The decimal value as a string in the MicroFocus zoned decimal format.
member.remarks:
The zoned decimal format used by MicroFocus, MicroSoft, and Fujitsu COBOL compilers use last character to imply the sign of the value. The characters 0 - 9 are used to represent positive values while the characters P - Y are used to represent negative values:
ASCII Character Value ASCII Character Value
00P-0
11Q-1
22R-2
33S-3
44T-4
55U-5
66V-6
77W-7
88X-8
99Y-9

member.name: M:Arx.Utils.DecimalUtilities.ToMicroFocusZonedDecimalString(System.Decimal,System.Int32)

member.name: T:Arx.ScheduledPaymentAccountResolutionProfile
member.summary: Defines the actions to take when a postdated or promise payment has a resolution flag added or removed.

member.name: P:Arx.ScheduledPaymentAccountResolutionProfile.ConfirmationAmount
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount at which the system will ask for user confirmation regarding the the resolution status of the account after the payment is posted.

member.name: P:Arx.ScheduledPaymentAccountResolutionProfile.RequireConfirmation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the user should be prompted for confirmation when adding a postdated or promise payment to an account.
member.remarks: Confirmation will only be requested when the amount of the payment is greater than the ConfirmationAmount.

member.summary: Gets or sets the unique name of this Scheduled Payment Account Resolution profile.

member.name: P:Arx.ScheduledPaymentAccountResolutionProfile.SettledInFullPaymentPostedActionId
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the action code to apply when a postdated or promise payment that has the Settled In Full flag set is posted as a transaction.

member.name: P:Arx.ScheduledPaymentAccountResolutionProfile.ForceResolutionSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the user should be forced to choose a resolution option when adding a postdated or promise payment. If this value is false the payment will save with "Unchanged" as the resolution flag unless the user chooses "Paid In Full" or "Settled In Full" when creating the payment.

member.name: T:Arx.PromisePayment
member.summary: Represents a promise payment that has been added to an account.
member.remarks: A promise payment is a payment that was scheduled by word of mouth (i.e. "I promise to pay $50 by June 1"). A promise payment does not contain any information that would allow the payment to be processed at the scheduled date. For payments that are processed when they are scheduled for a specific date see postdated payment.

member.name: T:Arx.PromisePayment.PromisePaymentStatus
member.summary: Defines the possible statuses of a promise payment.

member.name: F:Arx.PromisePayment.PromisePaymentStatus.Pending
member.summary: The promise payment is pending.
member.remarks: A promise payment remains in the pending status until it is kept or the date has passed the promise payment date plus the PromiseKeptGraceDays defined in the client profile.

member.name: F:Arx.PromisePayment.PromisePaymentStatus.Kept
member.summary: The promise payment has been kept.
member.remarks: A promise payment will be considered kept if the total amount of payments posted (that have not been reversed) from the date of the promise payment to the PromiseKeptGraceDays exceeds the PromiseKeptPercentage of the promise payment amount. PromiseKeptGraceDays and PromiseKeptPercentage are defined in the client profile.

member.name: F:Arx.PromisePayment.PromisePaymentStatus.Partial
member.summary: The promise payment has been partially kept.
member.remarks: A promise payment is considered partially kept if one or more a payment transactions have been posted to the account on or after the date of the promise payment and the total amount of these payments are below the PromiseKeptPercentage defined in the client profile.

member.name: F:Arx.PromisePayment.PromisePaymentStatus.Broken
member.summary: The promise payment has been broken.
member.remarks: A promise payment will be considered broken if the date has passed the promise payment date plus the PromiseKeptGraceDays and no payments have been posted to the account. PromiseKeptGraceDays is defined on the client profile.

member.name: F:Arx.PromisePayment.PromisePaymentStatus.NsfPayment
member.summary: The promise payment was previously Kept or Partial but one or more of the payments have been reversed with a NSF transaction code.

member.name: F:Arx.PromisePayment.PromisePaymentStatus.FullyRecovered
member.summary: The promise payment was previously NsfPayment but one or more payments have been posted that have FullyRecovered the promise amount.

member.name: F:Arx.PromisePayment.PromisePaymentStatus.PartiallyRecovered
member.summary: The promise payment was previously NsfPayment but one or more payments have been posted that have PartiallyRecovered the promise amount.

member.name: F:Arx.PromisePayment.PromisePaymentStatus.Unknown
member.summary: The promise payment is in an unknown status.

member.name: P:Arx.PromisePayment.AccountId
member.summary: Gets or sets the account id of the account that this promise payment belongs to.

member.name: P:Arx.PromisePayment.Amount
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of the promise payment.

member.name: P:Arx.PromisePayment.CreatedBy
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the user that added the promise payment to the account.

member.name: P:Arx.PromisePayment.PromiseDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date that the promise payment is scheduled for.

member.name: P:Arx.PromisePayment.Created
member.summary: Gets or sets the date that the promise payment was created.

member.name: P:Arx.PromisePayment.PromiseId
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique id of the promise payment.

member.name: P:Arx.PromisePayment.StatusDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date that the promise payment was considered to be stepped.

member.name: P:Arx.PromisePayment.AccountResolutionIndicator
member.summary: Gets or sets the account resolution mode for this promise payment.
member.remarks: The account resolution mode is used to indicate that when this promise is kept the account will be resolved because a settlement will be satisfied, resolved because the account will be paid in full or not resolved (no change).

member.name: P:Arx.PromisePayment.PreviousStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the previous status of this promise payment.

member.name: P:Arx.PromisePayment.Status
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of this promise payment.

member.name: P:Arx.PromisePayment.TransactionId
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the transaction that fulfilled (kept) this promise.

member.name: T:Arx.TransactionFeeProfile
member.summary: Transaction fee profiles track the costs that are incurred when a transaction is posted.
member.remarks: Fees may be charged by data processors that act as an intermediary between the agency and the client for the exchanged of data. This profile facilitates the tracking of those costs based on the type of transaction applied to accounts.

member.name: T:Arx.ActionCode
member.summary: Action codes represent standard, expected events in the life of an account. They can be used to track and handle events such as right party contact, fraud reporting, correspondence received, and many other events. Action codes can also act as macros that perform a group of functions such as setting the account status, scheduling the next work date, and moving the account to a support desk to ensure that the same procedures are followed every time the situation requiring an action code arises.
member.remarks: In order to apply an action code to an account the action code must be allowed by the and the access level of the (determined by the ) must be greater than or equal to the value of the property of the action code.

member.name: T:Arx.ClientLayout
member.summary: Represents a client layout.
member.remarks: Client layouts define the labels and field order that are used to display accounts to users. They also define the user level required to view and edit specific account properties.

member.name: P:Arx.ClientLayout.ClientAccount2Mask
member.summary: Gets or sets the display mask for client account 2.
member.remarks: A space will cause the character in that position of the value to be displayed, any other character will cause the character in that position of the value to be replaced with the mask character.
member.example:
A mask of XXXX will replace the leftmost 4 characters of the value with X:
Value Masked Value
1234XXXX
12345XXXX5

A mast of XX XX will replace the first 2 characters of the value with X, display the third character of the value and then replace the next 2 characters of the value with X.
Value Masked Value
1234XX3X
12345XX3XX
123456XX3XX6

member.name: P:Arx.ClientLayout.ClientAccountMask
member.summary: Gets or sets the display mask for client account.
member.remarks: A space will cause the character in that position of the value to be displayed, any other character will cause the character in that position of the value to be replaced with the mask character.
member.example:
A mask of XXXX will replace the leftmost 4 characters of the value with X:
Value Masked Value
1234XXXX
12345XXXX5

A mast of XX XX will replace the first 2 characters of the value with X, display the third character of the value and then replace the next 2 characters of the value with X.
Value Masked Value
1234XX3X
12345XX3XX
123456XX3XX6

member.name: P:Arx.ClientLayout.DateOfBirthMask

member.remarks: A space will cause the character in that position of the value to be displayed, any other character will cause the character in that position of the value to be replaced with the mask character.
member.example:
A mask of XXXX will replace the leftmost 4 characters of the value with X:
Value Masked Value
1234XXXX
12345XXXX5

A mast of XX XX will replace the first 2 characters of the value with X, display the third character of the value and then replace the next 2 characters of the value with X.
Value Masked Value
1234XX3X
12345XX3XX
123456XX3XX6

member.name: P:Arx.ClientLayout.DriversLicenseMask
member.summary: Gets or sets the display mask for drivers license fields.
member.remarks: A space will cause the character in that position of the value to be displayed, any other character will cause the character in that position of the value to be replaced with the mask character.
member.example:
A mask of XXXX will replace the leftmost 4 characters of the value with X:
Value Masked Value
1234XXXX
12345XXXX5

A mast of XX XX will replace the first 2 characters of the value with X, display the third character of the value and then replace the next 2 characters of the value with X.
Value Masked Value
1234XX3X
12345XX3XX
123456XX3XX6

member.name: P:Arx.ClientLayout.EmailMask
member.summary: Gets or sets the display mask for email fields.
member.remarks: An email mask consists of up to 3 characters. The first character will obscure everything before the @ sign, the second character will obscure the domain, and the third character will display the top level domain. A space will cause that section to display unmasked.
member.example:
This table contains examples of the results of various masking combinations:
Value Mask Masked Value
John.Smith@department.company.com John.Smith@department.company.com
John.Smith@department.company.comABCAAAAAAAAAA@BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB.CCC
John.Smith@department.company.comAB AAAAAAAAAA@BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB.com
John.Smith@department.company.comA CAAAAAAAAAA@department.company.CCC
John.Smith@department.company.com BCJohn.Smith@BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB.com

member.name: P:Arx.ClientLayout.IdMask
member.summary: Gets or sets the display mask to use for id fields.
member.remarks: A space will cause the character in that position of the value to be displayed, any other character will cause the character in that position of the value to be replaced with the mask character.
member.example:
A mask of XXXX will replace the leftmost 4 characters of the value with X:
Value Masked Value
1234XXXX
12345XXXX5

A mast of XX XX will replace the first 2 characters of the value with X, display the third character of the value and then replace the next 2 characters of the value with X.
Value Masked Value
1234XX3X
12345XX3XX
123456XX3XX6

member.name: P:Arx.ClientProfile.DebtorWebDisplayClientAccount

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the keyword profile group assigned to this client profile.

member.name: P:Arx.ClientProfile.AgentLicensingProfileName

member.name: P:Arx.ClientProfile.CalculateCommissionOnRemainingBalacneOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not commission should be calculated on the remaining balance of the account only in the event of an overpayment.
member.remarks: When this value is false commission will be calculated on the full amount of the payment, even if the payment exceeds the remaining balance on the account.

member.name: P:Arx.ClientProfile.OverrideSystemPostingClose
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the system setting which defines the minimum balance below which accounts will be automatically closed is override for clients that use this profile.

member.name: P:Arx.ClientProfile.PaidInFullFormulaName

member.remarks: Paid in full formulas determine whether or not an account can be resolved as paid in full.

member.remarks: Postdated payment dating plans define how far into the future postdated payment can be scheduled based on the type of postdated payment.

member.name: P:Arx.ClientProfile.PostDatedPaymentDatingPlanName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the postdated payment dating plan assigned to this client profile.
member.remarks: Postdated payment dating plans define how far into the future postdated payment can be scheduled based on the type of postdated payment.

member.name: P:Arx.ClientProfile.PostDatedPaymentEntryPlan

member.remarks: Postdated payment entry plans define how may postdated payments of the same type can be created on the same day.

member.name: P:Arx.ClientProfile.PostDatedPaymentEntryPlanName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the postdated payment entry plan assigned to this client profile.
member.remarks: Postdated payment entry plans define how may postdated payments of the same type can be created on the same day.

member.name: P:Arx.ClientProfile.PostingCloseBalanceStatus
member.summary: Gets the status to set the account to if the balance of the account falls below the amount. To update this value set the property.
member.remarks: This value is only considered if the property is set to true.

member.name: P:Arx.ClientProfile.PostingCloseBalanceStatusId
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the status to set the account to if the balance of the account falls below the amount.
member.remarks: This value is only considered if the property is set to true.

member.name: P:Arx.ClientProfile.PostingOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines the order in which a transaction will be applied to the various balance buckets.
member.remarks:
When a transaction is posted the amount of the transaction will be applied to the first non-zero bucket in the order defined by the posting order. If the transaction amount is greater than the current balance of the bucket the amount owing in that bucket will be applied and the remainder of the transaction will be applied to the next bucket in the list. The following characters must be present in the posting order and are case sensitive:
Value Description
PPrincipal
IInterest
1Fee 1
2Fee 2
3Fee 3
4Fee 4
5Fee 5
6Fee 6
7Fee 7
8Fee 8
9Fee 9
AAgency Fee 1
aAgency Fee 1 Interest
BAgency Fee 2
bAgency Fee 2 Interest
CAgency Fee 3
cAgency Fee 3 Interest
DAgency Fee 4
dAgency Fee 4 Interest
EAgency Fee 5
eAgency Fee 5 Interest

member.name: T:Arx.PostDatedPaymentType
member.summary: Defines a postdated payment type.
member.remarks: Postdated payment types define the information that must be collected to schedule and process a payment as well as the minimum and maximum values a payment can accept. Postdated payment types are grouped together for processing by the that the type belongs to. The types of postdated payments that can be added to an account are controlled by the assigned to the .

member.name: T:Arx.PostDatedPaymentType.PostDatedPaymentFieldMode
member.summary: Defines type of input expected and how to display each field (String1 to 6) of a postdated payment.
member.remarks: This value is configured on the postdated payment type.

member.name: F:Arx.PostDatedPaymentType.PostDatedPaymentFieldMode.Custom
member.summary: The field is a custom entry type.

member.name: F:Arx.PostDatedPaymentType.PostDatedPaymentFieldMode.Visa
member.summary: The field is a VISA credit card number.
member.remarks: VISA credit card numbers must begin with a 4 and have a valid Luhn checksum.

member.name: F:Arx.PostDatedPaymentType.PostDatedPaymentFieldMode.MasterCard
member.summary: The field is a MasterCard credit card number.
member.remarks: MasterCard credit card numbers must begin with a 5 and have a valid Luhn checksum.

member.name: F:Arx.PostDatedPaymentType.PostDatedPaymentFieldMode.Amex
member.summary: The field is an American Express (AMEX) credit card number.
member.remarks: AMEX credit card numbers must begin with a 3 and have a valid Luhn checksum.

member.name: F:Arx.PostDatedPaymentType.PostDatedPaymentFieldMode.Discover
member.summary: The field is a Discover Card credit card number.
member.remarks: Discover Card credit card numbers must begin with a 6 and have a valid Luhn checksum.

member.name: F:Arx.PostDatedPaymentType.PostDatedPaymentFieldMode.CanadianTransitNumber

member.name: T:Arx.TrustProfile
member.summary: Trust profiles contain the configuration and rules required to create a trust statement or invoice for a group of clients.

member.name: T:Arx.TrustProfile.RemittanceCalculationMode
member.summary: Defines the options for calculating the amount owed to the client and agency on a trust statement.

member.name: F:Arx.TrustProfile.RemittanceCalculationMode.Net
member.summary: Net remittance: The agency will remit all funds, less the agency's commission and taxes to the client. In the event that the net amount is negative the client will remit these funds to the agency.

member.name: F:Arx.TrustProfile.RemittanceCalculationMode.Gross
member.summary: Gross remittance: The agency will remit all funds to the client and the client will remit all commission and taxes to the agency.

member.name: F:Arx.TrustProfile.RemittanceCalculationMode.Dual
member.summary: Dual Net remittance: The agency will remit all funds, less the agency's commission and taxes to the client and the client will remit the client's commission and taxes to the agency.

member.summary: Consent has not been requested for the phone number or consent level is unknown.

member.summary: Consent has been requested but not yet granted.

member.name: T:Arx.SuspensePlan
member.summary: Represents a transaction suspense plan.
member.remarks: Suspense plans control how long transactions are held before they are considered cleared. By default, only transactions that have been cleared can be added to a trust statement. Defining a suspense plan automatically sets the clearing date a number of days from the date the transaction is posted this can help to ensure that a payment from a cheque has been fully processed by the financial institutions involved and will not bounce before the cheque payment is remitted to the client.

member.summary: Gets or sets the unique name of this suspense plan.

member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the country this time zone is located in.
member.remarks: If this value is empty this time zone will act as the default time zone for this UTC offset.

member.name: T:Arx.UserAccessRights
member.summary: Contains all user access rights.
member.remarks:
User access rights determine what a user can and cannot do within the ARx system. The rights are broken down into 3 categories:
CategoryDescription
Access rights that control what operations a user can perform on an account.
Access rights that control which administrative actions a user may perform. Examples include posting transactions and processing postdated payment batches.
Access rights that control which features and items the user may configure.

member.name: T:Arx.UserAccessRights.Administration
member.summary: Defines all available access rights for administrative functions.

member.name: F:Arx.UserAccessRights.Administration.AssignAccountToDifferentDesk
member.summary: User is allowed to reassign the account to a different desk than the one it is currently assigned to.

member.name: F:Arx.UserAccessRights.Administration.AssignAccountToDeskThatUserDoesNotHaveAccessTo
member.summary: User is allowed to reassign an account to a desk that they themselves do not have access to view accounts on.

member.summary: User can change the commission rate of an account.

member.summary: User has access to manage/create action cycle profile

member.summary: User can specify a new commission rate when posting a transaction.

member.summary: User can specify a new clearing date when posting a transaction.

member.summary: User can post transactions to accounts that are closed.

member.name: T:Arx.UserPasswordHistory
member.summary: Tracks the last passwords used by a user to prevent password reuse.

member.name: P:Arx.UserPasswordHistory.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password.

member.name: P:Arx.UserPasswordHistory.PasswordUsedUntil
member.summary: Gets or sets the date that the user changed their password to another password.

member.name: P:Arx.UserPasswordHistory.UserId
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the user.

member.name: M:Arx.UserPasswordHistory.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type and returns an integer that indicates whether the current instance precedes, follows, or occurs in the same position in the sort order as the other object.
member.returns: A value that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has these meanings: Value Meaning Less than zero This instance is less than . Zero This instance is equal to . Greater than zero This instance is greater than .
member.param: An object to compare with this instance.
member.exception: is not the same type as this instance.

member.name: M:Arx.UserPasswordHistory.Validate(System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is valid.
member.returns: A collection that holds failed-validation information.
member.param: The validation context.

member.name: T:Arx.WorkPlan
member.summary: Defines a work plan.
member.remarks: A work plan defines the expected or required life cycle of an account based on when key action codes should be applied to the account.

member.name: P:Arx.WorkPlan.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a description of this work plan.

member.name: P:Arx.WorkPlan.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique name of this work plan.

member.name: P:Arx.WorkPlan.RequiredAccess
member.summary: Gets the access flag that is required to maintain this type of system record.

member.name: M:Arx.WorkPlan.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type and returns an integer that indicates whether the current instance precedes, follows, or occurs in the same position in the sort order as the other object.
member.returns: A value that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has these meanings: Value Meaning Less than zero This instance is less than . Zero This instance is equal to . Greater than zero This instance is greater than .
member.param: An object to compare with this instance.
member.exception: is not the same type as this instance.

member.name: M:Arx.WorkPlan.Validate(System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is valid.
member.returns: A collection that holds failed-validation information.
member.param: The validation context.

member.name: M:Arx.WorkPlan.Save
member.summary: Saves this work plan.

member.name: T:Arx.WorkPlanItem
member.summary: Defines a work plan item.

member.name: P:Arx.WorkPlanItem.ActionCode
member.summary: Gets the action code associated with this work plan item.

member.name: P:Arx.WorkPlanItem.ActionCodeId
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the action code associated with this work plan item.

member.name: P:Arx.WorkPlanItem.Frequency
member.summary: Gets or sets how often this action code needs to be applied to an account in days.
member.remarks: Example: If the Frequency is 30 days the action code must be applied to the account at least every 30 days or the account will be in violation of the work plan.

member.name: P:Arx.WorkPlanItem.DaysAfterList
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of days after listing within which the action code must be applied to the account.

member.name: P:Arx.WorkPlanItem.DaysAfterLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of days after loading within which the action code must be applied to the account.

member.name: P:Arx.WorkPlanItem.DaysAfterNsfTransaction
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of days after an NSF transaction is posted to an account that the action code must be applied.

member.name: P:Arx.WorkPlanItem.DaysAfterPaymentTransaction
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of days after a payment transaction is posted to an account that the action code must be applied.

member.name: P:Arx.WorkPlanItem.RequiredAccess
member.summary: Gets the access flag that is required to maintain this type of system record.

member.name: M:Arx.WorkPlanItem.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type and returns an integer that indicates whether the current instance precedes, follows, or occurs in the same position in the sort order as the other object.
member.returns: A value that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has these meanings: Value Meaning Less than zero This instance is less than . Zero This instance is equal to . Greater than zero This instance is greater than .
member.param: An object to compare with this instance.
member.exception: is not the same type as this instance.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is valid.
member.returns: A collection that holds failed-validation information.
